The narrative also includes observations about the customs and manners of the native inhabitants, as well as expeditions conducted by notable individuals such as Lieutenant-Governor King and Captain Flinders. Following a recap of past troubles, Collins details the construction of a log prison to better control the convict population and reduce theft and disorder.
